page.title: 03Rights of Way
page.content: Many people in Harborough use the footpaths along the canal and country lanes for weekend walks. However, less follow the rights of way over the fields,either because they are unaware of the footpath route or because they have difficulty following it.The attitude of Harborough Rambling Club is one of persuasion of,and co-operation with,the local farmers. They are working to have the footpath routes marked,the stiles and fences on the paths maded easy to climb, and restrictions,such as barbed wire or overgrown hedges,cleared.They feel too that walters should respect the proper route.Often, however,the rights of way is difficult to find.For example the route from Green Lane to East Farndon has such obstructios as a steep,overgrown stream,difficult fences and alarge wheat field .
